summary: Employment marketplace project - building Step 1 (Core Foundation) with worker registration, job posting, browsing, and Internet Identity authentication
architectural_notes: Three-step incremental build approach: Step 1 (Core Foundation), Step 2 (Profile Features), Step 3 (Advanced Features)
Currently implementing Step 1 - Core Foundation with worker registration, job posting, browsing, and Internet Identity

existing_features.title: Implement job browsing interface where workers can view all available job postings with filters and search capabilities, and apply to jobs that match their skills and availability
Integrate Internet Identity authentication for secure login and user identity management, ensuring each user profile is associated with their Internet Identity principal
Create a landing page with clear call-to-action for workers and employers to register or login, explaining the platform's core value proposition
Implement role selection flow where new users choose between 'Worker' or 'Employer' role after authentication, then are directed to the appropriate registration form
Create separate dashboard views for workers and employers: worker dashboard shows available jobs and application status; employer dashboard shows posted jobs and received applications

Apply a creative and cohesive visual design theme with a distinct style (colors, typography, layout) that reflects the employment marketplace domain. Use professional, trustworthy aesthetics suitable for connecting workers with employers. Ensure consistent styling across all pages and components.

new_feature_requests.summary: Worker registration with essential fields (name, mobile, location, primary skills, experience, wage range)
Basic job posting (title, description, required skills, wage, location, dates)
Simple job browsing and application flow
Photo and document uploads for workers

Implement worker registration with essential fields: full name, mobile number, location (latitude/longitude coordinates), primary skills (multi-select from predefined list), years of experience, and wage range (minimum and maximum per day in currency units)

Implement basic job posting functionality for employers including job title, detailed description, list of required skills, offered wage per day, location coordinates, start date, end date, and number of positions available
